auto_build_bot_locales.description: Specifies whether to build the bot locales after bot creation completes.

s3_bucket.description: An Amazon S3 bucket in the same AWS Region as your function. The bucket can be in a different AWS account.

s3_object_key.description: The Amazon S3 key of the deployment package.

s3_object_version.description: For versioned objects, the version of the deployment package object to use. If not specified, the current object version will be used.

bot_file_s3_location.description: S3 location of bot definitions zip file, if it's not defined inline in CloudFormation.

weight.description: The degree to which the phrase recognition is boosted.

custom_vocabulary.description: A custom vocabulary is a list of specific phrases that you want Amazon Lex V2 to recognize in the audio input.

dialog_code_hook.description: Settings that determine the Lambda function that Amazon Lex uses for processing user responses.

active.description: Determines whether fulfillment updates are sent to the user. When this field is true, updates are sent.

allow_interrupt.description: Determines whether the user can interrupt the start message while it is playing.

delay_in_seconds.description: The delay between when the Lambda fulfillment function starts running and the start message is played. If the Lambda function returns before the delay is over, the start message isn't played.

value.description: The string that is sent to your application.

custom_payload.description: A message in a custom format defined by the client application.

text.description: The text that appears on the button.

value.description: The value returned to Amazon Lex when the user chooses this button.

buttons.description: A list of buttons that should be displayed on the response card.

image_url.description: The URL of an image to display on the response card.

subtitle.description: The subtitle to display on the response card.

title.description: The title to display on the response card.

image_response_card.description: A message that defines a response card that the client application can show to the user.

value.description: The message to send to the user.

plain_text_message.description: A message in plain text format.

value.description: The SSML text that defines the prompt.

ssml_message.description: A message in Speech Synthesis Markup Language (SSML).

variations.description: Message variations to send to the user.

message_groups.description: One to 5 message groups that contain update messages. Amazon Lex chooses one of the messages to play to the user.

start_response.description: Provides settings for a message that is sent to the user when a fulfillment Lambda function starts running.

timeout_in_seconds.description: The length of time that the fulfillment Lambda function should run before it times out.

allow_interrupt.description: Determines whether the user can interrupt an update message while it is playing.

frequency_in_seconds.description: The frequency that a message is sent to the user. When the period ends, Amazon Lex chooses a message from the message groups and plays it to the user. If the fulfillment Lambda returns before the first period ends, an update message is not played to the user.

ssml_message.description: A message in Speech Synthesis Markup Language (SSML).

variations.description: Message variations to send to the user.

message_groups_list.description: One to 5 message groups that contain update messages. Amazon Lex chooses one of the messages to play to the user.

message_selection_strategy.description: Indicates how a message is selected from a message group among retries.

allow_interrupt.description: Indicates whether the user can interrupt a speech prompt attempt from the bot.

allow_audio_input.description: Indicates whether audio input is allowed.

allow_dtmf_input.description: Indicates whether DTMF input is allowed.

end_timeout_ms.description: Time for which a bot waits after the customer stops speaking to assume the utterance is finished.

max_length_ms.description: Time for how long Amazon Lex waits before speech input is truncated and the speech is returned to application.

deletion_character.description: The DTMF character that clears the accumulated DTMF digits and immediately ends the input.

end_character.description: The DTMF character that immediately ends input. If the user does not press this character, the input ends after the end timeout.

end_timeout_ms.description: How long the bot should wait after the last DTMF character input before assuming that the input has concluded.

max_length.description: The maximum number of DTMF digits allowed in an utterance.

dtmf_specification.description: Specifies the settings on DTMF input.

start_timeout_ms.description: Time for which a bot waits before assuming that the customer isn't going to speak or press a key. This timeout is shared between Audio and DTMF inputs.

audio_and_dtmf_input_specification.description: Specifies the audio and DTMF input specification.

start_timeout_ms.description: Time for which a bot waits before re-prompting a customer for text input.

prompt_attempts_specification.description: Specifies the advanced settings on each attempt of the prompt.

prompt_specification.description: Prompts the user to confirm the intent.

intent_confirmation_setting.description: Prompts that Amazon Lex sends to the user to confirm the completion of an intent.

kendra_index.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Kendra index that you want the AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent intent to search.

query_filter_string.description: A query filter that Amazon Lex sends to Amazon Kendra to filter the response from a query.

query_filter_string_enabled.description: Determines whether the AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent intent uses a custom query string to query the Amazon Kendra index.

kendra_configuration.description: Configuration for searching a Amazon Kendra index specified for the intent.

time_to_live_in_seconds.description: The amount of time, in seconds, that the output context should remain active.

turns_to_live.description: The number of conversation turns that the output context should remain active.

output_contexts.description: A list of contexts that the intent activates when it is fulfilled.

parent_intent_signature.description: A unique identifier for the built-in intent to base this intent on.

utterance.description: The sample utterance that Amazon Lex uses to build its machine-learning model to recognize intents/slots.

priority.description: The priority that a slot should be elicited.

multiple_values_setting.description: Indicates whether a slot can return multiple values.

obfuscation_setting_type.description: Value that determines whether Amazon Lex obscures slot values in conversation logs. The default is to obscure the values.

obfuscation_setting.description: Determines whether Amazon Lex obscures slot values in conversation logs.

slot_type_name.description: The slot type name that is used in the slot. Allows for custom and built-in slot type names

default_value.description: The default value to use when a user doesn't provide a value for a slot.

default_value_list.description: A list of slot default values

default_value_specification.description: A list of default values for a slot.

allow_interrupt.description: Indicates whether the user can interrupt a speech prompt from the bot.

max_retries.description: The maximum number of times the bot tries to elicit a resonse from the user using this prompt.

title.description: The title to display on the response card.

image_response_card.description: A message that defines a response card that the client application can show to the user.

value.description: The message to send to the user.

plain_text_message.description: A message in plain text format.

value.description: The SSML text that defines the prompt.

ssml_message.description: A message in Speech Synthesis Markup Language (SSML).

variations.description: Message variations to send to the user.

message_groups_list.description: One to 5 message groups that contain update messages. Amazon Lex chooses one of the messages to play to the user.

timeout_in_seconds.description: If Amazon Lex waits longer than this length of time in seconds for a response, it will stop sending messages.

still_waiting_response.description: The response that Amazon Lex sends periodically to the user to indicate that the bot is still waiting for input from the user.

allow_interrupt.description: Indicates whether the user can interrupt a speech prompt from the bot.

value.description: The string that is sent to your application.

custom_payload.description: A message in a custom format defined by the client application.

text.description: The text that appears on the button.

value.description: The value returned to Amazon Lex when the user chooses this button.

buttons.description: A list of buttons that should be displayed on the response card.

image_url.description: The URL of an image to display on the response card.

subtitle.description: The subtitle to display on the response card.

title.description: The title to display on the response card.

plain_text_message.description: A message in plain text format.

value.description: The SSML text that defines the prompt.

ssml_message.description: A message in Speech Synthesis Markup Language (SSML).

message.description: The primary message that Amazon Lex should send to the user.

value.description: The string that is sent to your application.

custom_payload.description: A message in a custom format defined by the client application.

text.description: The text that appears on the button.

value.description: The value returned to Amazon Lex when the user chooses this button.

buttons.description: A list of buttons that should be displayed on the response card.

image_url.description: The URL of an image to display on the response card.

subtitle.description: The subtitle to display on the response card.

title.description: The title to display on the response card.

image_response_card.description: A message that defines a response card that the client application can show to the user.

value.description: The message to send to the user.

plain_text_message.description: A message in plain text format.

value.description: The SSML text that defines the prompt.

ssml_message.description: A message in Speech Synthesis Markup Language (SSML).

variations.description: Message variations to send to the user.

message_groups_list.description: One to 5 message groups that contain update messages. Amazon Lex chooses one of the messages to play to the user.

waiting_response.description: The response that Amazon Lex sends to indicate that the bot is waiting for the conversation to continue.

wait_and_continue_specification.description: Specifies the prompts that Amazon Lex uses while a bot is waiting for customer input.

value_elicitation_setting.description: Settings that you can use for eliciting a slot value.

locale_id.description: The identifier of the language and locale that the bot will be used in.

nlu_confidence_threshold.description: The specified confidence threshold for inserting the AMAZON.FallbackIntent and AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent intents.

kms_key_arn.description: The Amazon KMS key required to decrypt the contents of the grammar, if any.

s3_bucket_name.description: The name of the S3 bucket that contains the grammar source.

s3_object_key.description: The path to the grammar in the S3 bucket.

source.description: Describes the Amazon S3 bucket name and location for the grammar that is the source for the slot type.

grammar_slot_type_setting.description: Settings required for a slot type based on a grammar that you provide.

external_source_setting.description: Provides information about the external source of the slot type's definition.

parent_slot_type_signature.description: The built-in slot type used as a parent of this slot type.

value.description: The value that can be used for a slot type.

sample_value.description: Defines one of the values for a slot type.

value.description: The value that can be used for a slot type.

synonyms.description: Additional values related to the slot type entry.

slot_type_values.description: A List of slot type values

audio_recognition_strategy.description: Enables using slot values as a custom vocabulary when recognizing user utterances.

advanced_recognition_setting.description: Provides settings that enable advanced recognition settings for slot values.

regex_filter.description: A regular expression used to validate the value of a slot.

value_selection_setting.description: Contains settings used by Amazon Lex to select a slot value.

engine.description: Indicates the type of Amazon Polly voice that Amazon Lex should use for voice interaction with the user. For more information, see the engine parameter of the SynthesizeSpeech operation in the Amazon Polly developer guide.

voice_id.description: The Amazon Polly voice ID that Amazon Lex uses for voice interaction with the user.

voice_settings.description: Settings for using an Amazon Polly voice to communicate with a user.

key.description: The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

value.description: The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 0 to 256 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

bot_tags.description: A list of tags to add to the bot, which can only be added at bot creation.

data_privacy.description: Data privacy setting of the Bot.

role_arn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that has permission to access the bot.

code_hook_interface_version.description: The version of the request-response that you want Amazon Lex to use to invoke your Lambda function.

lambda_arn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Lambda function.

lambda_code_hook.description: Contains information about code hooks that Amazon Lex calls during a conversation.

code_hook_specification.description: Contains information about code hooks that Amazon Lex calls during a conversation.

enabled.description: Whether the Lambda code hook is enabled

bot_alias_locale_setting.description: You can use this parameter to specify a specific Lambda function to run different functions in different locales.

locale_id.description: A string used to identify the locale

bot_alias_locale_settings.description: A list of bot alias locale settings to add to the bot alias.

kms_key_arn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an AWS Key Management Service (KMS) key for encrypting audio log files stored in an S3 bucket.

log_prefix.description: The Amazon S3 key of the deployment package.

s3_bucket_arn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon S3 bucket where audio log files are stored.

s3_bucket.description: Specifies an Amazon S3 bucket for logging audio conversations

destination.description: The location of audio log files collected when conversation logging is enabled for a bot.

audio_log_settings.description: List of audio log settings that pertain to the conversation log settings for the bot's TestBotAlias.

cloudwatch_log_group_arn.description: A string used to identify the groupArn for the Cloudwatch Log Group

log_prefix.description: A string containing the value for the Log Prefix

destination.description: Defines the Amazon CloudWatch Logs destination log group for conversation text logs.

text_log_settings.description: List of text log settings that pertain to the conversation log settings for the bot's TestBotAlias

conversation_log_settings.description: Contains information about code hooks that Amazon Lex calls during a conversation.

detect_sentiment.description: Enable to call Amazon Comprehend for Sentiment natively within Lex

sentiment_analysis_settings.description: Determines whether Amazon Lex will use Amazon Comprehend to detect the sentiment of user utterances.

test_bot_alias_settings.description: Configuring the test bot alias settings for a given bot

key.description: The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

value.description: The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 0 to 256 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

test_bot_alias_tags.description: A list of tags to add to the test alias for a bot, , which can only be added at bot/bot alias creation.

block.description: Amazon Lex conversational bot performing automated tasks such as ordering a pizza, booking a hotel, and so on.
